title: Methi Paratha/ Fenugreek leaves Paratha || Punjabi Style
content:
Healthy Breakfast:  Servings - 2 Duration: 20 - 25 minutes  Paratha is a flatbread originated from North India 🇮🇳 .It's a special breakfast for Punjabi's in Punjab and also in Gujarat. Now a days it's popular all over India and also serving in Indian restaurants There are many types of Paratha's which can be prepared with Wheat flour/ Atta/ Maida and also veggies for stuffing Mainly, it's cooked with ghee/ butter/ cooking oil and serves with curd and any kind of pickle (Indian pickles) Today I prepared a very simple and healthy nutritional breakfast, that's Methi Paratha/ Fenugreek leaves Paratha in Punjabi Style 😃 Ingredients: Wheat flour - 1 cup Fenugreek leaves/ Methi leaves 🍃- 1 cup Red chilli powder - 1/2 tb sp Green chillies - 3 chopped Ginger - 2 inch Turmeric - 1 teaspoon Butter - 1/2 tb sp ( melted ) Salt - 1 teaspoon Procedure:
  • Add Chopped ginger and green chillies in mixer grinder. Blend smooth and keep it aside
  • Wash fenugreek/ Methi leaves twice and drain
  • Chop them and keep aside
  • In medium sized bowl add fenugreek, salt, red chilly powder, cumin/ Jeera, ginger- green chillies paste
  • Mix them well
  • Add wheat flour and mix well
  • Add water little by little in wheat flour 🌾
  • Make perfect non-sticky dough don't add so much of water because already moisture present in methi/ fenugreek leaves
  • Rest the dough for 5 mins
  • Heat tava on medium to high
  • Take some amount of wheat flour to dust
  • Divide the dough into equal parts
  • Take one ball , dust with wheat flour And roll circle
  • Fold left and right sides at center and again first fold left and then right side
  • As shown in picture
  • Now again dust flour and roll the dough upwards and downwards
  • Make Paratha thicker than chapathi/ Roti's
  • Take Paratha in hands and put on hot tava
  • Flip the Paratha when started bubbles on it
  • You can see brown dots and apply butter on it
  • Again flip the other side apply butter
  • Cook both sides nicely
  • Serve Methi Paratha hot with Raita/Curd and mango pickle
  • It's yummy 😋 have it as Breakfast/ Dinner time
